content: If a plane travels at an average speed of 550 miles per hour and needs to cover a distance of 2,750 miles, how long will the flight take?

To determine how long the flight will take, you can use the formula for time, which is derived from the relationship between distance, speed, and time. The formula is:

\[ \text{time} = \frac{\text{distance}}{\text{speed}} \]

Given that the plane travels at an average speed of 550 miles per hour and needs to cover a distance of 2,750 miles, you can plug these values into the formula:

\[ \text{time} = \frac{2,750 \text{ miles}}{550 \text{ miles per hour}} \]

Now, perform the division:

\[ \text{time} = 5 \text{ hours} \]

So, the flight will take 5 hours.
